channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MA

item.title: Report E-2023100424
item.description:
Report E-2023100424

  • City: NORTH READING
  • State: MA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDEX FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Associate did not block and/or brace freight properly for transport. Freight was crushed causing release of product.

item.title: Report X-2023090650
item.description:
Report X-2023090650

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-11T15:10:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-12
  • City: NATICK
  • State: MA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was being unloaded when the package handler noticed the bottom was wet, he notified the manager and QA was called. Brain then placed the package in a red bin and brought it to the hazmat cage place it under the ventilation with the vent on. DescribePack: All four caps were loose. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The hazmat was placed in a red hazmat bin and taken to the hazmat cage placed under the vent.

item.title: Report X-2023090648
item.description:
Report X-2023090648

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-11T15:10:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-11
  • City: NATICK
  • State: MA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was discovered by the van driver, who noticed that the box has wet dry marking and he brought it to the attention of QA. The QA team member placed the hazmat in a red bin and brought the damage hazmat to the hazmat cage and placed it under the vent with the ventilation system on. DescribePack: The hazmat was only wrap inside bubble wrap and place inside a box that was too big for the size of the hazmat. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: The hazmat was put inside of a red bin and placed inside of the hazmat cage with the vent on.

item.title: Report X-2023080470
item.description:
Report X-2023080470

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-17T00:34:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-14
  • City: LYNNFIELD
  • State: MA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: THE UNLOADER WAS UNLOADING WHEN HE CAME UPON A PACKAGE WITH A STRONG ODOR AND LIQUD COMING OUT AT THE CORNER OF THE BOX. THE UNLOADER THEN LEFT THE AREA AND NOTIFIED HIS SUPERVISOR. THE SUPERVISOR CALLED FOR A DESIGNATED RESPONDER. THE RESPONDER, FOLOWING THE DESICION TREE AND APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET CLEANED UP THE SPILL. THE EQUIPMENT WAS DECONTAMINATED FOLLOWING THE EQUIPMENT DECONTAMINATION CHECKLIST. THE PACKAGE WAS THEN TRANSPORTED TO THE DMP AREA FOR FURTER PROCESSING. THEN DETERMINED TO BE UNDECLARED.
